1.label: Set to Default
1.description: Set all configuration values to default values (factory settings).

3.label: Control Type
3.description: The way the Built-in Dimmer reacts when light is turned on/off with button

options.label: Switch own light on and send a Z-Wave message to all associated nodes (direct and external)
Don.t switch own light on but only send a Z-Wave message to associated node. (external only)

4.label: Dimming enabled
4.description: This parameter is used to enable the dimming option of the product. When disabled the dimming and fading routine are disabled.

6.label: Maximum Power load
6.description: The maximum power load in watts when light is turned on, when measured higher then this value the Inline Dimmer is automatically turned off.

7.label: Dimming Speed
7.description: The speed of dimming when activated (manual and RF). Dim speed is 1% per value (* 10 ms)

8.label: Fading up  Speed
8.description: The speed of fading up when activated (manual and RF). Fade speed is 1% per value (* 10 ms)

11.label: Auto meter report: percentage
11.description: A percentage that an energy value must be different compared to a previous sent value before an unsolicited meter report is sent. Minimum value = 0% (disabled report)  Maximum value = 100%

12.label: Auto meter report: watt
12.description: A watt value that an energy value must be different compared to a previous sent value before an unsolicited meter report is sent. Minimum value = 0 watt  (disabled report) Maximum value = 255 watt

13.label: Auto meter report: time
13.description: A time value that has to be passed compared to a previous sent value before a unsolicited meter report is sent. Minimum value = 10 seconds  Maximum value = 255 seconds

14.label: Last known status
14.description: What to do with lamp status when power applied. If 0x00: Always switch light off when power applied. If > 0x00: Switch lamp on/off depending on last known lampstatus before power was disconnected.

15.label: Fading down speed
15.description: The speed of fading up when activated (manual and RF). Fade speed is 1% per value (* 10 ms)
